</div>
<div style="max-width:650px; margin:auto; background:#ffffff; padding:25px 30px; border-radius:18px; box-shadow:0 6px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.08); font-size:1.1rem; color:#405080; line-height:1.7; text-align:center; transition:transform 0.3s ease, box-shadow 0.3s ease;">

Build your foundation in <b>Data Science with R</b> and unlock the power of data-driven insights.
</p>
<p><b>Mode:</b> Online</p>
<p><b>Duration:</b> 7 Days (Daily 1.5 - 2 hrs sessions)</p>
<p><b>For:</b> Undergraduates, Students</p>

Certificate Provided &nbsp; | &nbsp; Hands-on Practice &nbsp; | &nbsp; Live Q&A

  <!-- Schedule -->
  <section class="schedule-section" id="schedule">
  <div class="section-title">Training Schedule</div>
  <div class="schedule-caption">7 Days | Daily 1.5 - 2 hours sessions | Online Mode</div>
  <table class="schedule-table">
<tr>
<th>Day</th>
<th>Topics</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 1<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">Introduction</span></td>
<td><strong>Introduction to Data Science and R</strong><br>
Overview of Data Science: What is data science? Role in agricultural research<br>
Introduction to R: Installation, RStudio interface, R scripts vs console<br>
Basic R operations: Arithmetic, objects, vectors<br>
<em>Hands-on: Writing your first R code, simple data manipulations</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 2<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">Data Structures</span></td>
<td><strong>Data Structures in R</strong><br>
Core structures: Vectors, matrices, data frames, lists, factors<br>
Agriculture examples: Crop yield data, soil properties, weather data<br>
<em>Hands-on: Creating and managing data frames, indexing, subsetting</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 3<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">Data Handling</span></td>
<td><strong>Data Import, Cleaning, and Visualization</strong><br>
Importing data: CSV, Excel, text files<br>
Data wrangling: Missing values, renaming, recoding<br>
Basic visualization: plot(), hist(), boxplot(), ggplot2 intro<br>
<em>Hands-on: Cleaning an agriculture dataset (e.g., crop trials), plotting distributions</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 4<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">EDA</span></td>
<td><strong>Descriptive Statistics and Exploratory Data Analysis</strong><br>
Descriptive statistics: Mean, median, variance, SD, skewness, kurtosis<br>
EDA: Patterns, outliers, correlations<br>
<em>Hands-on: Summary statistics with agriculture datasets (soil nutrients, rainfall)</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 5<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">Statistics</span></td>
<td><strong>Statistical Inference</strong><br>
Concepts: Population vs sample, hypothesis testing, t-tests, chi-square<br>
Confidence intervals: Meaning and interpretation<br>
<em>Hands-on: Hypothesis testing on small agricultural experiments</em></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 6<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">Modeling</span></td>
<td><strong>Regression and Prediction</strong><br>
Simple linear regression: Concept, interpretation, model fitting in R<br>
Multiple regression: Adding more predictors<br>
<em>Hands-on: Predicting yield based on rainfall, fertilizer, and soil parameters</em><br>
Intro to model diagnostics: Residual plots, R²</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Day 7<br><span style="font-size:0.98rem">AI & Future</span></td>
<td><strong>Introduction to AI & LLMs in Agriculture</strong><br>
What are LLMs?: Basics of large language models, how they are trained<br>
Applications in agriculture: Crop advisory chatbots, literature summarization, automating data cleaning<br>
Demo: Using RAISINS-AI for research data analysis<br>
<em>Hands-on: Intro to ellmer and ragnar packages in R</em><br>
<strong>Wrap-up:</strong> Review of course, Q&A, feedback</td>
</tr>
</table>
